title: PREMIUM-Ep. 299: Philosophy in Shakespeare's "Timon of Athens" (Part Three)
description:
Mark, Wes, and Dylan conclude our discussion of Shakespeare's play. Chiefly, we talk about the exchanges about art in the play: How does art relate to life and to commerce?

If you're not hearing the full version of this part of the discussion, sign up via one of the options described at partiallyexaminedlife.com/support.
